Overview

What is ADF Faces

ADF Faces is the Oracle Application Development Framework (ADF) view technology based on JavaServer Faces (JSF). In the initial production release, ADF Faces will be mostly a port of ADF UIX, as explained in the document ADF UIX Roadmap. You do not, however, need to be familiar with ADF UIX to use ADF Faces. You do need to be familiar with JSF. If you are not familiar with JSF, please see the roadmap link above.

Future Releases

Fusion Tier 2 will be the next release.

What ADF Faces adds over standard JSF

Please see the faq question on this topic.

Target audience

This release is targeted at developers who understand JSF and want to see what JSF support Oracle is working on. Please see the ADF UIX Roadmap for more information about ADF Faces and how it fits into the future of ADF.

APIs are not final

APIs are very stable but will not be final until production. No migration tool will be provided to upgrade from one tier version to another.

Visual Editing

WYSIWYG visual editing for ADF Faces is available in Oracle JDeveloper 10g (10.1.3) Early Access. It will be fully supported in the production version.

Zip Contents

This zip contains the following

  • '/docs' contains documentation.
  • '/lib' contains the ADF Faces jars and Oracle dependencies
  • '/src' contains demo source code
  • 'adf-faces-demo.war' contains demos.
